Covers async/await, dependency injection, Entity Framework Core, Dapper, configuration, caching, and testing with xUnit. Use when developing .NET backends, reviewing C# code, or designing API architectures.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and code template skill. Contains no executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution. All content is educational material with example C# patterns for .NET backend development.

content.value_statement: Developing .NET backends requires understanding async patterns, dependency injection, and database access strategies. This skill provides proven templates and best practices for building APIs that are maintainable, testable, and performant.
actual_capabilities: Generate service implementation templates with Result pattern and validation
Create repository patterns using EF Core and Dapper
Implement multi-level caching strategies with Redis and memory cache
Apply dependency injection patterns with scoped, singleton, and transient lifetimes
Write unit and integration tests with xUnit, Moq, and WebApplicationFactory
Configure applications using IOptions pattern with typed configuration classes
limitations: Does not generate complete projects or scaffold folder structures automatically
Does not execute code or interact with running .NET applications
Templates require manual integration into existing projects
Does not provide database migration scripts or deployment guidance

prompt_templates.title: Create Service
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a service implementation for [EntityName] with CRUD operations using the Result pattern, dependency injection, and validation. Include cache-aside pattern and proper error handling.

prompt_templates.title: Add Repository
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a [Dapper/EF Core] repository for [EntityName] with async methods for search, pagination, and bulk operations. Include parameterized queries and proper connection handling.

prompt_templates.title: Configure DI
prompt_templates.prompt: Write service registrations for [ServiceName] with proper lifetime (scoped/singleton/transient), IOptions configuration, and keyed services if needed.

prompt_templates.title: Write Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write xUnit tests for [ServiceName] using Moq. Include happy path, validation failures, and error scenarios. Use Fact and Theory attributes with proper assertions.

output_examples.input: Generate a product service with Result pattern and caching
output: Result<T> pattern with Success/Failure static methods
ILogger injection with proper log levels
CancellationToken propagation through all async methods
Soft delete support with repository pattern

best_practices: Use async/await all the way through the call stack and always pass CancellationToken to async methods
Prefer Result<T> over exceptions for business logic failures and validate inputs at API boundaries
Use AsNoTracking() for read-only queries and select only needed columns to reduce memory usage
anti_patterns: Never block on async code with .Result or .GetAwaiter().GetResult() as this causes deadlocks
Avoid exposing EF entities directly in API responses - use DTOs for data transformation
Do not use string concatenation for SQL queries - always use parameterized queries to prevent injection

faq.question: What .NET versions are supported?
faq.answer: Templates target .NET 8+ and use C# 12 features like primary constructors and collection expressions.

faq.question: What is the maximum response size?
faq.answer: Response size depends on the query. Use pagination with configurable page sizes (default 50, max 200).

faq.question: Can I use this with Minimal APIs?
faq.answer: Yes. All service patterns work with both controller-based APIs and Minimal API endpoints using dependency injection.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only generates code templates. It does not access files, databases, or transmit any data externally.

faq.question: Why are my queries slow?
faq.answer: Use AsNoTracking() for reads, select only required columns, add database indexes for filter columns, and consider Dapper for hot paths.

faq.question: How does this compare to other skills?
faq.answer: This skill provides C#/.NET specific patterns. Use general API design skills for language-agnostic REST principles.
